question: [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Function: PrunerOpt::pruner_config()] [Integer overflow] Can an attacker provide extremely large values for state_prune_window, epoch_snapshot_prune_window, or ledger_prune_window that cause integer overflow when used in pruning calculations, potentially corrupting the test database or causing panics? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Function: PrunerOpt::pruner_config()] [Resource exhaustion] Can setting pruning_batch_size values (ledger_pruning_batch_size, state_pruning_batch_size, epoch_snapshot_pruning_batch_size) to extremely small values (e.g., 1) cause performance degradation severe enough to halt benchmark execution, creating a local DoS condition? [File: aptos-core/execution/executor-benchmark/src/main.rs] [Function: PrunerOpt::pruner_config()] [Configuration bypass] Can an attacker enable all pruners simultaneously with conflicting window sizes that create race conditions between different pruner types, leading to inconsistent database state during benchmarks?
